name: Dinner Tonight: Pan-Fried Pork Chops with Chipotle Butter
description: I'm sure everyone has their pork chop recipe, since it's a great cut for weeknight dinners—it takes well to quick-cooking and the directions for possible sauces are endless. Bourbon teriyaki, soy-and-honey, fennel seeds with sage and rosemary, cherry barbecue—just a...
recipeIngredient: salt and freshly ground black pepper
1-2 chipotle chilis in adobo, with sauce to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Cook, without moving, 4-5 minutes or until well-browned. Flip, and cook until done, depending on thickness. Alternatively, sear the other side and finish in a 375 degree oven.
Meanwhile, chop the chilis and add to softened butter in a small bowl, mixing well. Add adobo sauce to taste for spiciness. Season with salt.
Let chops rest 4 minutes after cooking to ensure juiciness. Top with a bit of butter and serve.
